intro: Pentace erectinervia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a tropical shrub native to Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often milky sap. The plant typically has simple, alternate leaves with prominent veins, and it produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
